newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Francophone airlines lobby to cut technology prices.
newsitem.headline: Francophone airlines lobby to cut technology prices.

text.p: Representatives of the international association of francophone countries operating in Africa said they would lobby to get cuts in prices of various technological services, Moroccan state-owned Royal Air Maroc (RAM) said on Wednesday.
"Participants recommended negotiating computer distribution prices so that they square with their effective use," the RAM statement said.
The association, which groups 15 airlines, also appointed RAM Head, Mohamed Hassad, president of the association for three years.
